content: Hybrid vehicles are popular! The initial cost is steep, from what I've heard, unless cost is no object, hybrids are not the way to go. They are good for fuel economy and the environment, but the expense is something some of us can't just afford! I'd like to hear your thoughts! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

title: Hybrid vehicles!

content: Honda, Toyota, and the Ford Fusion are IMO the best hybrid vehicles out there. A Toyota Prius can be had for about $22,000 to $26,000 depending on your buying skills. The 2010 Prius gets 50 to 70 MPG highway. It might be better and cheaper to buy one this year than to wait a few years since this new law passed by Obama on cars getting 35.5 mpg will cost on average $1300.00 more in a few years. The battery pack on a hybrid is under warranty for 100,000 and to replace one on a Toyota will set you back about $3,000.00 including labor. However, I usually trade in a car once I get about 50,000 miles on it so I don't have to worry about items like that. Not to mention I get a better trade in price the less miles on the car. Gas prices will never go down until we the people start waking up and buy smarter, smaller, and greener. Look up the Toyota Prius in Consumer Reports and you will notice it is listed as the best selling hybrid and has the best customer satisfaction rating of any hybrid sold in the US. I'm buying one late this summer.

content: Well I presently have a 1998 Mazda Protege, my last one was a 1983 Mazda 626. It has only about 68000 miles on it and is still running well. I don't get new cars until I really need to, so maybe by the time I do decide to get a new car hybrids will be the only type available.
